text: Margaritasite is a yellow, caesium-bearing mineral in the carnotite group. Its chemical formula is (Cs, K, H3O)2(UO2)2V2O8·H2O and its crystal system is monoclinic. ==Name and discovery== It was first described in 1982 from the Margaritas uranium deposit in the Peña Blanca district of the municipality of Aldama, in the Mexican state of Chihuahua. ==See also== * List of minerals ==References== * Mindat.org - Margaritasite * Handbook of Mineralogy - Margaritasite Category:Vanadate minerals Category:Caesium minerals Category:Potassium minerals Category:Uranium(VI) minerals Category:Monoclinic minerals
